docs.title: Marketplace
docs.text:
Marketplace product introduces a list of predefined features to fulfill common and complex tasks related to the B2B marketplace management. It uses the Virto atomic architecture principles to bring extensibility to the product to adjust it to the specific project needs.

Our Marketplace solution provides separate self-service portals to manage a range of tasks for each of the primary roles in marketplace management:

  • Operator portal for operators, i.e. marketplace owners or representatives.
  • Vendor portal for vendors, also known as sellers, merchants, distributors, suppliers, etc.
Operator portalVendor portal

The Operator Portal shares many functionalities with the Platform. You can refer to the Platform user documentation for guides on modules like Catalog, Pricing, Notifications, and more. Below are the marketplace specific features:

Item Description
  • Add new category to master catalog
  • Add properties to category
  • Add, edit, or delete static commissions to vendor
  • Assign static commission to vendor
  • Add and assign dynamic commission to vendor or product
  • Edit or delete dynamic commission
    • Onboard (add) new vendors
    • Manage vendor from Operator portal
    • Manage vendor from Vendor portal
    • Approve vendor's products
    • Decline vendor's products
    • Manage product from Vendor portal
    • Edit offers, product availability, and price tags
    • View submitted orders
    • Manage submitted orders
    • View, add, or configure order processing workflows
    Item Description
    • Edit orders received from buyers
    • Confirm, cancel, pack, and ship orders
    • Create shipment documents
    • Add products to catalog
    • Add offers to own products
    • Add offers to another vendor's products
    • Add product associations
    • Add offers to your products
    • Add price tags to offers
    • Import products and offers in bulk using CSV files
    • Monitor feedback submitted by buyers
    • Manage your company's basic information
    • Manage your team members
    • Manage the inventory aspects and fulfillment centers

docs.title: Marketplace Products
docs.text:
The Operator portal allows operators to manage products uploaded by vendors. The Marketplace products section in the main menu displays all the products uploaded by all vendors in the marketplace, including product descriptions, images, categories, status, and vendor. Operators can list, view, edit, approve, or decline uploaded products and provide the reason for the decline.

Let's explore most common scenarios and:

  • Approve vendor's product.
  • Decline vendor's product.
  • Manage product from the Vendor portal.

docs.title: Approve product
docs.text:
To approve a product uploaded by a vendor in the Vendor portal:

  1. Click Marketplace products in the main menu to open the list of all products from all marketplace vendors.
  2. In the next blade, find products with Wait for approval status. Click on the one you need to review.

  3. In the next blade, check the correctness of products properties. Click Approve in the toolbar if the product information meets the marketplace requirements.

The product status in the list of products changes for Published in both Operator and Vendor portals:

  • Operator portal

  • Vendor portal

docs.title: Decline product
docs.text:
To decline a product uploaded by a vendor in the Vendor portal:

  1. Click Marketplace products in the main menu to open the list of all products from all marketplace vendors.
  2. In the next blade, find products with Wait for approval status. Click on the one you need to review.
  3. In the next blade, check the correctness of products properties. Click Decline in the toolbar if the products information does not meet the marketplace requirements.

  4. In the popup window, specify the reason for decline and confirm the action:

The product status in the list of products changes for Rejected in both Operator and Vendor portals:

  • Operator portal

  • Vendor portal

Note

Operators can now unpublish and republish products. This feature allows operators to quickly remove products that do not meet the marketplace’s standards, have become outdated, or are no longer aligned with the marketplace’s goals.

docs.text:

  2. In the next blade, find a product you need to edit.
  3. In the next blade, click Open in Vendor portal in the toolbar.
  4. The Vendor portal opens in a new window:

docs.title: Master Catalog
docs.text:
The Master catalog serves as the central repository for all products listed in the marketplace. It includes products from all vendors. This ensures a unified and standardized product database. The Marketplace Operator portal allows you to set up a master catalog taxonomy. That is, configure a structure of catalog categories and a set of properties that can be configured for each category. Operators can create and manage product categories and subcategories within the Master catalog. This structure groups products in a logical, easy-to-navigate arrangement. Operators review products submitted by vendors. They approve the products before they appear in the Master catalog.

Let's explore a standard scenario and:

  • Add new category to the master catalog.
  • Adding properties to the newly created category.

docs.title: Add new category
docs.text:
To add a new category to the master catalog (for example, a robotic lawnmower):

  1. Click Master catalog in the main menu.
  2. In the next blade, select a master catalog.
  3. In the next blade, select a category you need to add a new category to. In our example, Garden and Leisure → Garden tools and garden machines → Mowing machines.
  4. Click Add in the toolbar to add a new item.
  5. In the next blade, select an item you need to add. In our case, Category.
  6. In the next blade, enter the category name.
  7. Click Create to save the changes.

Your category has been added to the categories and items of master catalog.

docs.title: Add properties to category
docs.text:
To add properties to the newly created category:

  1. Click the three dots to the left of the name of the newly created category and select Manage from the dropdown list.
  2. In the next blade, click on the Properties widget.
  3. In the next blade, manage the properties.
  4. Click OK to save the changes.

Your properties have been added to the master catalog and become available for vendors in the Vendor portal:

docs.title: Registration Requests
docs.text:
If a vendor wants to register on the marketplace, they can fill out a registration form that opens up to unregistered users:

After the vendor submits the form, the Operator sees it in the Registration requests section of the Operator portal with the Pending status:

Note

An operator can fill out the form on behalf of a vendor by clicking New request in the toolbar.

The Operator can:

  • Process the registration if additional steps are required. It receives Processing status in the list of registration requests.
  • Decline the registration if it does not meet the necessary criteria. It receives Declined status in the list of registration requests.

  • Complete the registration if no additional information is required. This will open the following form, which will be pre-filled with the information provided by the vendor:

    Complete the form and click invite to send the invitation to the Vendor. The registration requests receives the Completed status.

    Note

    The statuses can be edited in the State machines section.

    A new Vendor entity will be added to the list of vendors. The Vendor will receive an account activation link at the submitted email address. Once the account is activated, the owner can start using the Vendor portal and work with the Marketplace.

Note

After successful registration of a new vendor, operator can open their vendor portal directly from the registration form:

Operators can open Vendor portal on behalf of a vendor from the Vendors section.

docs.title: State Machines
docs.text:
The State machines section manages and automates the various states and their transitions within the marketplace.

To add a flow:

  1. Click State machines in the main menu.
  2. The next blade lists all the available order state flows. Click Add in the toolbar to add a new flow.

  3. In the next blade, click Open Visual Editor:

    Note

    The flows are applicable for the following entity types:

  4. In the next blade, you can create a flow:

    in Visual Editorin JSON mode

    1. Click Visual editor to create a flow:

      1. Click Add new state to create a block specifying a state of the flow, for example, New:

      2. Create the second block, such as Confirmed, and connect it to the New block by extending a line between them. Then, specify the trigger.

      3. Create a third block, such as Canceled, and connect it to the New block by extending a line between them. Then, specify the trigger.

      Note

      Hovering over transition lines or states highlights the connected units.

    2. Switch to JSON mode to view the flow automatically converted into a JSON file.

    3. Click the checkbox once to mark a status as Fail, twice for Success, and three times to leave it unmarked:

    1. Switch to JSON mode in the toolbar.
    2. Type or paste a new flow in the JSON format.

  5. Click Create in the previous toolbar.

  6. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

You new states flow has been added to the list.

docs.title: Dynamic Commission Fees
docs.text:
With the dynamic commission fees feature, you can assign a commission fee that overrides a static commission. The dynamic commissions can be applied to:

  • Vendors.
  • User groups.
  • Products.
  • Product categories.

It is common to use dynamic when there is a need to override static commissions for a particular products category or a specific product.

Managing dynamic commission fees includes:

  • Adding a new dynamic commission and assigning it to a vendor or a product.
  • Editing a dynamic commission.
  • Deleting a dynamic commission.

  4. In the new blade, fill in the following fields:

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Commission structures are a fundamental component that determines how the marketplace operators earn revenue from the transactions. In Virto Commerce Marketplace, the commission fees feature allows a marketplace owner to flexibly setup commissions to be deducted from each transaction or transaction item for the benefit of the marketplace.

The commissions can be assigned to:

  • Vendor.
  • Vendor group.
  • Product or products sets.
  • Category or a set of categories.

In Virto Commerce Marketplace, you can setup:

  • Static commission fees, which are fixed-rate fees applied to transactions irrespective of any varying factors.
  • Dynamic commission fees, which are variable rates that can apply to product, product category, or a vendor.

← Master catalog Static commission fees →

docs.title: Static Commission Fees
docs.text:
Static commission fees are the fees that are assigned to a Vendor and applied by default to each transaction of that Vendor. The static commission fee can be set as a percentage of the original transaction or as a fixed amount.

Managing static commission fees includes:

  • Adding a new static commission.
  • Editing a static commission.
  • Deleting a static commission.
  • Assigning a static commission to a vendor.

docs.title: Add static commission
docs.text:
To add a new static commission:

  1. Click Commissions in the main menu.
  2. In the next blade, select Static to open the list of available commission fees:

  3. In the Static commissions blade, click Add in the toolbar to add a new static commission.

  4. In the new blade, fill in the following fields:

  5. Click Create to save the changes.

The commission has been added.

docs.text:
To edit a static commission:

  1. Click Commissions in the main menu.
  2. In the next blade, select Static to open the list of available commission fees.
  3. In the next blade, select the commission you need to edit.
  4. In the next blade, edit the desired fields.

docs.text:
Note

Default commission fee can not be deleted.

To delete a static commission:

  1. Click Commissions in the main menu.
  2. In the next blade, select Static.
  3. In the next blade, select the commission you need to delete.
  4. In the next blade, click Delete in the toolbar.

The commission has been deleted.

docs.title: Assign static commission
docs.text:
To assign a static commission fee to a Vendor:

  1. Click Vendors in the main menu to open the list of vendors.
  2. Select the desired Vendor from the Vendors blade to open the vendor details.
  3. Click next to the Commission field to open the Static commissions blade or select a fee from a dropdown list.
  4. Select one of the predefined commission fees or add a new one.
  5. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

Note

It is common to define Vendor tiers in the marketplace and configure commissions based on the defined vendor levels (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold).

The commission has been assigned to a vendor.

docs.text: Vendors are the key entities in every marketplace. That’s why it is crucial for the operator to have an extensive and user-friendly way of managing them. To onboard (add) a new vendor, the marketplace operator must collect all the necessary vendor information. After that, the operator can start adding new vendor to a marketplace.

docs.title: Import
docs.text:
To upload large volumes of products and offers simultaneously, vendors can use the Import section:

  1. Click Import in the main menu.
  2. In the next blade, click Add in the toolbar to add new profile for import.
  3. In the next blade, enter profile name, then select importer type from a dropdown list:
    • CsvProductImporter to upload product details only.
    • CsvOfferImporter to upload offers without changing the product details.
    • CsvProductOfferImporter to upload both product details and their associated offers in one go.
    • D365PackageImporter to import data specifically from Microsoft Dynamics 365, using its package format.
  4. After you fill in the above fields, you can download a template for reference and set a delimiter.
  5. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

  6. Your newly created profile appears in the list. Click on it.

  7. In the next blade, browse your CSV file or enter its URL.

  8. Click Start import. You can monitor the upload status below.

When you see the Completed status, your products have been successfully uploaded.

docs.title: Marketplace Products
docs.text:
Marketplace products is a list of all the products uploaded by all vendors in the marketplace. Observing the products offered by other vendors helps the vendor understand trends, pricing strategies, and product features.

In this section, vendor can:

  • View the list of all marketplace products:

  • View products details and associations.

  • View prices offered for each product.
  • Add own product to marketplace.

Videos, Assets and Offers can be added to the product after it has been saved

docs.title: My Store
docs.text:
The My Store section provides vendors with essential tools to manage their store's information and operations. It consists of three key subsections:

  • Profile.
  • People.
  • Fulfillment Centers.

docs.title: Profile
docs.text:
In this subsection, you can manage your company's basic information:

  • Provide your company name and detailed information about the company.
  • Enter your company address.
  • Upload a company logo.
  • View the commission rate assigned to you by the marketplace operator.

docs.title: People
docs.text:
This subsection allows you to manage your team members:

  • Add employees to your vendor account.
  • Upload photos of your employees.
  • Activate or deactivate employee accounts.
  • Delete employees when necessary.
  • Assign roles to employees from a dropdown list, which can restrict access to certain functions within the vendor portal.
  • Invite employees.

docs.title: Fulfillment centers
docs.text:
This subsection is designed for managing the inventory aspects of your store:

  • View the list of available fulfillment centers.
  • Add new fulfillment centers to your store's operations.
  • Assign external IDs to fulfillment centers for synchronization purposes, such as synchronizing inventory across different systems.

docs.text:
The Orders segment contains all orders created by the buyers. Here vendors can:

  • Edit orders.
  • Process orders.

docs.title: Edit order
docs.text:
To edit the order:

  1. Click Orders in the main menu to open the list of the received orders.
  2. In the next blade, select the desired order. The order details will open in the next blade.

  3. Offer details are displayed in the bottom right corner. Click on any item to view and edit its details:

  4. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

Your modifications have been applied.

docs.title: Process order
docs.text:
The newly created orders are processed in accordance with the created states flow. In our example, the orders are processed as follows:

  1. Confirm or cancel the new order. Cancelled orders cannot be further processed.
  2. The confirmed order can be packaged or cancelled. Cancelled orders cannot be further processed.

  3. The packaged orders can be shipped. Further processing is impossible.

Note

Once an order status changes from New, the edit button will no longer be available.

Setting order states and order flows

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Vendor Portal brings a set of tools to complete all Marketplace related tasks for a vendor. Here a vendor will be able to upload catalog, manage offers (prices and inventory), process orders and much more. It is designed to properly resize on the smaller screens so that a vendor would be able to complete his tasks on mobile devices without having to search for the desktop size screen. So the marketplace will always be in the hands of a vendor.

Open the Vendor Portal homepage to see its structure and main features:

docs.title: Key features
docs.text:
The Vendor Portal suggests the following key features for vendors:

  • Products management.
  • Offers management.
  • Orders processing.
  • Rating and reviews overview.
  • Employees management.
  • Fulfillment centers management.
  • Organization details editing.
  • Quote requests management.

← Operator Portal overview Orders →

docs.text:
The Products menu item includes:

  • Marketplace Products: Products uploaded by all vendors in the marketplace. Use this section to add your own offer to another vendor's products.
  • My Products: Products uploaded by the current vendor in their marketplace. Use this section to add your own products and offers or manage product associations.

A product can be associated with multiple offers, each of which provides a specific product variation, its price, and its inventory. Each offer can contain multiple price tags, reflecting various pricing strategies or conditions. In the example below, the product ("Laptop Model A") is associated with different offers, each offer has multiple price tags:

You can view products either as a list or organized by category:

docs.title: Add offer to another vendor's product
docs.text:
If you want to add your own offer for a product listed by another vendor:

  1. Click Marketplace Products in the main menu to open the list of all products in the marketplace.
  2. In the next blade, click on the desired product to open its details.
  3. In the next blade, click on the Offers widget.

  4. In the next blade, click Add in the toolbar to add your own offer.

  5. In the next blade, fill in the required fields.

  6. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

Your offer has been added to the list of offers for the product. All vendor-created product offers are stored in the Offers section of the main menu, where they can be easily managed. Complete your offer by adding price tags.

docs.title: Add own product
docs.text:
To add your own product to the marketplace:

  1. Click My Products in the main menu to open the list of your products.
  2. In the next blade, click Add in the toolbar to add a new product.

  3. In the next blade, enter all the descriptive data of the product, such as name, description, code, image(s), etc.

    Note

    A vendor can only upload products to the categories assigned by a marketplace operator. When a Vendor adds a product, it can only be assigned to one category from the list available to him.

    You can use our AI Assistant to generate product descriptions, translate them into the desired language, or apply the generated information:

  4. Product accent colors can be automatically assigned based on their entered English name using standard HTML color names. Users can still manually adjust the color code if needed:

  5. Click Save as draft in the toolbar to save the changes.

  6. Click Submit for approval to submit your product for approval by an Operator Portal manager. Only after the product has been approved and the offer for the product has been created it will be available for purchase by a customer.

Product approval process

Now you can add offer to your product.

docs.title: Add offer to own product
docs.text:
After your product has been approved by an Operator Portal manager it appears in the list of vendor's products with the Is published status. Now you can add your offers (variations) to the published product:

  1. Click on the published product in the list of products.
  2. In the next blade, click on the Offers widget.
  3. In the next blade, click Add in the toolbar to add your own offer.
  4. In the next blade, fill in the required fields.

  5. Click Save in the toolbar to save the changes.

Your offer has been added to the product. All vendor-created product offers are stored in the Offers section of the main menu, where they can be easily managed. Another way to add offers to your products is described here.

Complete your offer by adding price tags.

docs.title: Add price tags to offer
docs.text:
For various pricing strategies a vendor might set different price tags for a single product:

  1. Select an offer from the offers list.
  2. In the next blade, click on the Price tags widget.

  3. In the next blade, fill in the required fields.

    Note

    The Vendor Portal supports multi-currencies pricing and volume-based pricing (configured through the Store module).

  4. Click Confirm in the toolbar, then Save to save the changes.

Your price tag has been added to the offer:

docs.title: Manage product associations
docs.text:
To increase sales and improve product discovery, Vendors can manage product associations:

  1. Click My Products in the main menu to open the list of your products.
  2. In the next blade, select the desired product.
  3. In the next blade, click on the Associations widget.

  4. In the next blade, add associations to the product:

The associations have been added.

docs.title: Communicate with Operator
docs.text:
When an Operator has a question about a Vendor's product, the Vendor will see it in the Communication widget:

Clicking on the widget, opens a communication blade, where the Vendor can send instant replies to the Operator:

All dialogs are stored in the Communication section of the main menu, where they can be easily managed.

docs.title: Quotes
docs.text:
The Quotes segment contains all quotes submitted to the vendor:

Clicking a quote opens its details. The vendor can either accept the quoted price or modify it.

The created quotes are processed in accordance with the defined states flow. In this example, the quotes are processed as follows:

  1. The submitted quotes require processing. The vendor can either send a proposal or cancel it. Canceled quotes cannot be further processed.

  2. If the vendor sends a proposal, the buyer can either place an order if the proposal is acceptable, or decline it.

docs.text:
The Rating and Reviews segment allows vendors to view the reviews submitted by buyers. This helps vendors stay informed about customer feedback on their products.
